question: Which country was the location of the "Battle of Mohacs, 1526"?
explanation: Hungary was the location of the "Battle of Mohacs, 1526". The Battle of Mohacs was one of the most consequential battles in Central European history. It was fought on 29 August 1526 near Mohacs, Kingdom of Hungary, between the forces of the Kingdom of Hungary and its allies, led by Louis II, and those of the Ottoman Empire, led by Suleiman the Magnificent. The Ottoman victory led to the partition of Hungary for several centuries between the Ottoman Empire, the Habsburg Monarchy, and the Principality of Transylvania.
